title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway Park, struggling offensively with only two hits and making three errors.
Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings, while Boston failed to score with runners in scoring position.
Yankees' victory highlighted Red Sox's playoff doubts despite both teams' high postseason probabilities.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., now with the Washington Commanders, suffered a season-ending quad injury against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders after eight years with the New England Patriots.
Following surgery news, Wise shared a positive message on Instagram, thanking fans for their support and expressing gratitude.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early, Boston's No. 6 prospect, may start against the Athletics next Tuesday at Fenway Park.
Early struck out 11 batters and allowed no runs in his MLB debut, tying a Red Sox strikeout record.
Red Sox evaluating pitching options with young players like Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison in the mix.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Scott Boras and Alex Bregman will decide on his contract opt-out after the current MLB season.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million deal with the Red Sox including an opt-out after 2025.
Bregman's performance and leadership have been influential for the Red Sox, impacting young players this season.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Season 5 of 'Only Murders in the Building' featuring Steve Martin, Martin Short, and Selena Gomez is now on Hulu.
'Warfare', co-directed by Ray Mendoza and Alex Garland, is streaming on HBO Max highlighting a 2006 mission in Iraq.
'The Girlfriend' starring Robin Wright is streaming on Prime Video as a psychological thriller about family conflicts.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White are ruled out for the Patriots' game against the Dolphins.
Gonzalez has been sidelined with a hamstring injury since July and did not play in Week 1.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for Sunday's game against Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins with Terrell Williams away.
Terrell Williams is absent due to an undisclosed health issue, unrelated to a previous health scare.
Zak Kuhr, new to the role, has experience from Ohio State, the Titans, and a prior stint with the Patriots.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges before her scheduled October trial in Boston.
Cannon-Grant, along with her late husband, allegedly misused nonprofit funds and committed mortgage and unemployment fraud.
She faces a 27-count indictment with potential decades-long prison time and significant fines if convicted.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, from Washington, Utah, was arrested for the suspected murder of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.
Court documents allege Robinson had become more politically active, viewing Kirk as spreading hate.
Robinson, a third-year Dixie Technical College student, has no prior criminal record and lives with his parents.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees begin crucial series at Fenway Park with playoff stakes high for both teams.
Boston leads the season series 8-2 and will have top pitchers Lucas Giolito, Brayan Bello, and Garrett Crochet starting.
Yankees depend on home runs, hitting 249 this season, and are just ahead in the wild-card standings.
